data.description: Drexel Internship 2026 - EngineeringCompany:Boeing has shaped the course of human history through aerospace innovations. Today, because of our amazing people and powerful technologies, our products connect the globe, protect freedom, and advance scientific discovery around the world. From the depths of the ocean, to Mars and beyond, we're inspiring the next century of explorers – we invite you to join us on the journey ahead!Boeing is seeking passionate and motivated Engineering Co-ops for its Software, Industrial, Manufacturing, Reliability/Maintainability, Systems, Mechanical Systems, Structures Engineering and Wire Installation and Wire Design teams.The Software Engineering Co-op Student will work on the Simulated Chinook Operational Flight Program (SCO) for the Chinook Classroom Virtual Maintenance Trainer (CVMT). This role involves developing and maintaining software that simulates the Chinook OFP, enabling interactive use of virtual cockpit displays for maintenance and fault diagnosis.The Industrial Engineering Co-op Student will support the development of plant and equipment layouts, capacity plans, accident prevention measures, sequencing of operations and work flows. Participates in the evaluation of new techniques and technological developments for integration into the production process and service operations. Assists with designing, maintaining, and optimizing the production system by integrating design, supply base, facilities, equipment, and personnel. Conducts basic work flow design and analysis. Develops simple models, databases and spreadsheets to analyze data and provides summary analysis and metrics for consultation to leaders.The Manufacturing Engineering Co-op Student will support the development and implementation of production and tooling methodologies. Participates as a member of our production team to support the integration of technical solutions across multiple disciplines. Supports the development, identification and implementation of conceptual designs and maintenance of the program architecture for build. Participates in the implementation of manufacturing plans. Investigates technical problems. Participates in the implementation of Lean principles and technologies. Interfaces with IPTs and internal customers to develop products, skills, knowledge and experience.The Reliability and Maintainability Systems Engineering Co-op Student will learn and perform Reliability & Maintainability (R&M) tasks such as Predictions, Allocations, Failure Mode & Effect Analyses, R&M testing, and Failure Review, Corrective Action and Maintainability Analysis. R&M engineer may also perform maintenance, health and optimization of engineering systems which track, monitor, report, and statistically model design changes.  Additionally, candidate can expect to engage in initiatives to streamline inefficiencies through the use of automation and assist in analyses of Product Assurance and System Effectiveness.The Systems Engineering Co-op Student within the Philadelphia Design Center (PDC) will assist in the development and integration of complex systems across the Boeing company. This role involves system requirements definition and documentation, verification planning, validation execution and cross-functional collaboration on design solutions and analyses.Mechanical Systems Engineering Co-op Student: Develops mechanical systems component detail and assembly designs in the area of Hydraulics, ECS, Fuels, etc. Document processes, specifications and procedures that support the design and manufacture of mechanical system parts and assemblies. Participate in technical review of supplier designs and non-conformances. Analyzes results and support design reviews.Structures Engineering Co-op Student: Develops, integrates and documents structural requirements to establish the system design. Coordinates with other engineering groups to establish the product's environment. Guides product design and verifies structural integrity by using analytical methods, finite element models/simulations and other analysis tools throughout the product lifecycle to develop the structural environment, characteristics and performance. Develops test plans and configurations, supports test execution and analyzes/reports test results to validate and verify systems and components meet requirements and specifications. Defines and documents certification and test results to substantiate for customers and regulatory agencies that requirements are satisfied. Supports in-service products by investigating failures and analyzing improvements.Wire Installation and Wire Design Engineering Co-op Student: Develops and maintains basic cable/wire harness and equipment detail and assembly designs. Assists with engineering design disposition on discrepancies (e.g., rejection tags, production action requests, shop revision requests). Develops and maintains basic electrical product detail, assembly and installation designs (e.g., equipment racks, power panels, cable routing and geometry, antennas). Follows documented processes, specifications and procedures that support the design and manufacture of electrical commodities. Collects data to support the development of statements of work. Assists in data gathering of supplier capabilities. Reviews functional and physical input used in the development of integrated design and system architecture.As a participant in our Co-op at Boeing, you’ll gain hands-on experience, learn from experts, and collaborate with teams that do truly amazing things. You will be working in a challenging engineering environment that will expose you to design, development and production of aircraft. This unique experience will provide you a great opportunity to develop your engineering skills. Over the course of our Drexel Co-op experience you will have the opportunity to:Work directly with a mentor in your field of study while finding solutions to real world problemsExperience our products up close by touring our state-of-the-art manufacturing and research facilitiesInteract directly with our company leaders to discuss strategy and the future of BoeingBuild a lasting professional network through social events and engaging activitiesGain the skills and knowledge to become a future leader in the aerospace industryThese positions allow telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options.These positions must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. "US Person" includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.Basic Qualifications:Enrolled student attending Drexel University with an expected graduation date on or after August 2026.Ability to intern 6 months from fall 2025 to spring 2026Preferred Qualifications:Exceptional communication skills and interest and enthusiasm related to engineering, aerospace, and a career with Boeing.Candidate should be able to work in a team environment.Strong academic performance.Exceptional organizational and collaboration skills as demonstrated through leadership positions on teams and/or in student or civic organizations.Strong technical experiences as demonstrated through technical projects, research, or engineering internships.Relocation:These positions offer relocation based on candidate eligibility.Drug Free Workplace:Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.Shift: These positions are for 1st shiftAt Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.Summary Pay Range: $52,000 - $73,000Applications for this position will be accepted until August 26, 2025 .Language Requirements:Not ApplicableEducation:Not ApplicableRelocation:This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.Export Control Requirement:Safety Sensitive:Security Clearance:This position does not require a Security Clearance.Visa Sponsorship:Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.Contingent Upon Award ProgramThis position is not contingent upon program awardShift:Shift 1 (United States of America)Stay safe from recruitment fraud!
